byline.contributor: Maggie Haberman and Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Amy Chozick from New York.
byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN, MICHAEL D. SHEAR and AMY CHOZICK

abstract: News Analysis; Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr's announcement that he will not seek Democratic presidential nomination comes after months in which he has harbored intense private disagreement with positions Hillary Rodham Clinton has taken in pursuit of nomination; while in public two have traded expressions of admiration and warmth, Biden has been critical of way Clinton has distanced herself from Pres Obama's legacy.
lead_paragraph: Part of their tension grew out of what the vice president saw as his role as the natural successor to carry President Obama’s legacy forward.

headline.main: Warm in Public, Joe Biden and Hillary Clinton Have Been Intense Rivals in Private
headline.print_headline: Warm in Public, Biden and Clinton Have Been Intense Rivals in Private

snippet: Part of their tension grew out of what the vice president saw as his role as the natural successor to carry President Obama’s legacy forward.
